intro: Gibbaeum dispar, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, low-growing succulent that typically forms dense mats on rocky outcrops. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, adding a delicate touch to its rugged habitat. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid conditions. Gibbaeum dispar is well adapted to dry environments and is often found in coastal regions and mountainous areas.
